SafetyInspectionBy: Iowa Dept of Agriculture and Land Stewardship

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EEXECUTIVE SUMMARY



A.   The Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policy

Van Diest Supply Company?s accidental release prevention policy is a unified approach that integrates technology, procedure, and management practices, while complying with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations for our anhydrous ammonia storage.  If an accidental release were to occur, Van Diest Supply Company is prepared and trained to work with the local fire department, or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and to the environment.



B.   A Brief Description of the Facility and the Substances Handled

Van Diest Supply Company is a formulator, distributor, and dealer of agricultural chemicals, and a dealer of fertilizers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application on the field.  Bulk storage tanks and nurse tanks are used to store the anhydrous ammonia on site.  



C.  The Accidental Release Prevention Program

For our ammonia tanks, Van Diest Supply Company implements the provisions of the ?Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Ammonia, K-61.1? published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc., and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, ?Storage and Handling of Ammonia?.



Impact distances for any release will be limited by mitigation devices such as check valves, relief valves, and excess flow valves, as well as the training of our employees in our Emergency Response Program.



D.   Five Year Accident History

Van Diest Supply Company has never had an incident involving  ammonia which caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, or evacuations. 



E.   Emergency Response Program

Van Diest Supply Company has a written emergency action plan (in accordance with OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.38) including pre-emergency planning and employee training, and has provided state and local

authorities with the emergency planning and community right to know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).  Both of these have been coordinated with the Region V Emergency Planning Committee.



F.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Safety improvement is an on-going process at Van Diest Supply Company.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
